issues.title: A2A Support for SendMessage
issues.body:
Google announced a new Agent2Agent Protocol which is basically SendMessage but with a universal protocol plus an "Agend Card" similar to MCP tools which declares the name of the Agent and description:

https://github.com/google/A2A

issues.title: Open Source OpenAI Operator like integration
issues.body:
Hey team,  

I came across [`[browser-use](https://github.com/browser-use/browser-use)`](https://github.com/browser-use/browser-use), which provides a lightweight way to track and manage browser interactions efficiently, like the new OpenAI Operator. Given that **Agency-Swarm** focuses on AI-driven automation and coordination, do you see potential in integrating `browser-use` to enhance browser automation, user behavior analysis, or session management?  

It also has Deep Research functionalities.

Would love to hear your thoughts on feasibility and possible benefits!  

Thanks!

issues.title: this is what cursor thinks the framework
issues.body:
After reviewing the code, I've identified several potential flaws in the current agency-swarm implementation:
Thread Management Issues:
The Thread class doesn't properly clean up resources when a thread is cancelled or fails
There's no timeout mechanism for long-running operations
The _num_run_retries counter is reset on init_thread() but there's no maximum retry limit
Error Handling Gaps:
The ToolNotFoundError is raised but not properly handled in all cases
The _try_run_failed_recovery method doesn't have a clear strategy for different types of failures
BadRequestError from OpenAI API isn't properly handled in all cases
Async Mode Problems:
The async mode implementation in ThreadAsync has a race condition where multiple messages could be sent before status is checked
The worker method doesn't handle exceptions properly, which could leave threads in a hung state
The check_status method doesn't handle network errors
Resource Management:
No proper cleanup of OpenAI resources when threads are deleted
Memory leaks possible due to not clearing message history
No rate limiting implementation for API calls
State Management Issues:
The _called_recepients list is reset on init_thread() which could cause duplicate calls
No proper state tracking between runs
Shared state between threads isn't properly synchronized
Validation Problems:
The _validate_assistant_response method doesn't have clear validation criteria
No validation of tool outputs before submission
No validation of message format before sending
Configuration Issues:
Hard-coded values like max_workers = 4 in Thread class
No configuration for timeouts
No proper handling of environment variables
Communication Flow:
The message passing between agents isn't properly synchronized
No proper handling of circular dependencies in agent communication
No proper handling of message ordering
Tool Execution:
Tool execution doesn't have proper timeout handling
No proper handling of tool execution failures
No proper cleanup of tool resources
Documentation and Logging:
Insufficient logging for debugging
Missing documentation for error handling
No clear documentation for async mode usage
These issues could be contributing to the problems we've been seeing with:
Timeout issues during agent communication
Tool not found errors
Thread management problems
State inconsistencies between runs
Would you like me to propose specific fixes for any of these issues?
what version is that

Let me check the version information from the repository:
The version of agency-swarm in the repository is 0.4.5, which matches what we have installed in your environment. This is the latest version available on PyPI.
Let me also check the requirements to see what dependencies it's using:
The key dependencies are:
openai >= 1.66.0, < 2.0.0
pydantic 2.8.2
python-dotenv 1.0.1
rich 13.7.1
This version (0.4.5) is the latest stable release of agency-swarm. The issues we've been seeing are not due to using an outdated version, but rather due to some of the architectural flaws I identified in the codebase. Would you like me to propose specific fixes for any of those issues?

issues.title: RuntimeError: This event loop is already running - When Using Agency Swarm in FastAPI Application
issues.body:
Dear Agency Swarm Development Team, I'm encountering a technical challenge with our FastAPI implementation that I'd like to discuss. ## Environment - Agency Swarm version: 0.4.4 - Python version: 3.12.1 - FastAPI version: 0.115.8 - OS: Linux (server environment) ## Problem Description We're experiencing a consistent `RuntimeError: This event loop is already running` when our FastAPI application attempts to use `agency.get_completion()` within an asynchronous endpoint. The error specifically occurs when one agent (CommunicationAgent) tries to communicate with another agent (PlanfixAgent). ## Error Stack Trace ``` Error getting completion from agency: This event loop is already running Traceback (most recent call last): File "/root/Projects/agreement_management_agency/agreement_management_server.py", line 260, in background_process_and_respond response = agency.get_completion(message_content) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "/root/Projects/agreement_management_agency/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/agency_swarm/agency/agency.py", line 210, in get_completion message = next(res) ^^^^^^^^^ File "/root/Projects/agreement_management_agency/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/agency_swarm/threads/thread.py", line 274, in get_completion output = yield from handle_output(tool_call, output) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "/root/Projects/agreement_management_agency/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/agency_swarm/threads/thread.py", line 190, in handle_output item = next(output) ^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "/root/Projects/agreement_management_agency/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/agency_swarm/threads/thread.py", line 274, in get_completion output = yield from handle_output(tool_call, output) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "/root/Projects/agreement_management_agency/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/agency_swarm/threads/thread.py", line 190, in handle_output item = next(output) ^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "/root/Projects/agreement_management_agency/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/agency_swarm/threads/thread.py", line 286, in get_completion tool_outputs = self._await_coroutines(tool_outputs) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "/root/Projects/agreement_management_agency/.venv/lib/python3.12/site-packages/agency_swarm/threads/thread.py", line 695, in _await_coroutines results = loop.run_until_complete( ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "/root/.pyenv/versions/3.12.1/lib/python3.12/asyncio/base_events.py", line 660, in run_until_complete self._check_running() File "/root/.pyenv/versions/3.12.1/lib/python3.12/asyncio/base_events.py", line 619, in _check_running raise RuntimeError('This event loop is already running') RuntimeError: This event loop is already running ``` ## Implementation Details Our application structure: 1. We have a FastAPI server with asynchronous endpoints 2. We're using Agency Swarm to manage communication between multiple agents 3. The error occurs in an async function `background_process_and_respond` when calling `agency.get_completion(message_content)` 4. The FastAPI server is already running an event loop, and the `_await_coroutines` method in Agency Swarm's `Thread` class attempts to create another one ## Agency Configuration We have an agency with 4 agents: - AgreementManager (entry point) - PlanfixAgent - BrowsingAgent - CommunicationAgent With communication flows: - AgreementManager -> PlanfixAgent - AgreementManager -> BrowsingAgent - AgreementManager -> CommunicationAgent - CommunicationAgent -> PlanfixAgent ## Attempted Solutions 1. We tried using a generator approach to handle the completion without starting a new event loop 2. We attempted to use `nest_asyncio` to patch the event loop, but it didn't resolve the issue 3. We've ensured our webhook handling and error processing are working correctly ## Agent Communication Analysis Below is a chronological analysis of the communication between agents when the error occurs: ``` UNIFIED CHRONOLOGICAL TIMELINE This timeline shows all events from all threads in chronological order. Switching to thread: thread_63yacYB801migtpIEu9Bx5RX [user -> AgreementManager] [2025-03-04 13:06:43] MESSAGE - USER (user -> AgreementManager): 04-03-2025 14:06/task_number: 150736/Khainatsky Ivan/message:

issues.title: Repeated Messages from OrchestratorAgent
issues.body:
**Description**:
I am experiencing an issue with an `OrchestratorAgent` that inherits from Agent where it sends repeated messages to the user. This seems to occur when the agent processes responses from the OpenAI API, leading to the same output being sent multiple times.

**Steps to Reproduce**:
1. Initialize the `OrchestratorAgent`.
2. Send a message to create a process.
3. Observe the output in the logs.

**Expected Behavior**:
The agent should send a single, complete response to the user without repeating the same message multiple times.

**Actual Behavior**:
The agent sends the same message repeatedly, which appears to be a result of how streaming responses are handled.
issues.author: AMGMNPLK

issues.title: Genesis rate limit
issues.body:

I have been trying to uses Genesis for creating an agency, and it seems to work like a charm. However, after some time it fails due to the OpenAI rate limit of 30000 TPM.

Would it make sense to implement a throttling feature to prevent this, or is there another trick?

CreateTool âš™ï¸ Function Output
Certainly! Below is the revised InterviewTool class that meets the specified requirements and uses a local dictionary to simulate the shared_state for testing purposes:


 from agency_swarm.tools import BaseTool
 from pydantic import Field
 from typing import List, Dict

 class InterviewTool(BaseTool):
     """
     This tool will conduct in-depth client interviews to gather information about their unique value propositions and personal brand aspirations.
     It should be able to store and organize the interview data for further analysis.
     """

     client_name: str = Field(
         ..., description="The name of the client being interviewed."
     )
     interview_questions: List[str] = Field(
         ..., description="A list of questions to ask the client during the interview."
     )
     interview_responses: Dict[str, str] = Field(
         default_factory=dict, description="A dictionary to store the client's responses to the interview questions."
     )

     # Simulate shared_state with a local dictionary
     shared_state: Dict[str, Dict] = {}

     def run(self):
         """
         Conducts the interview by asking each question and storing the responses.
         """
         for question in self.interview_questions:
             # Simulate asking the question and getting a response
             response = input(f"{question} ")
             self.interview_responses[question] = response

         # Organize the interview data for further analysis
         organized_data = {
             "client_name": self.client_name,
             "responses": self.interview_responses
         }

         # Store the organized data in the shared state for further analysis
         self.shared_state[f"{self.client_name}_interview_data"] = organized_data

         return f"Interview with {self.client_name} completed and data stored."

 # Example usage:
 # tool = InterviewTool(client_name="John Doe", interview_questions=["What is your unique value proposition?", "What are your personal brand aspirations?"])
 # tool.run()


In this version, the shared_state is simulated using a local dictionary within the InterviewTool class. This allows for testing the tool's functionality without relying on an external shared state mechanism. The
interview data is stored in this local dictionary for further analysis.

Please make sure to now test this tool if possible.
`

issues.title: Refactor MessageHandler and follow Clean Architecture, SOLID and DDD principles
issues.body:
**Current Situation:**
The MessageHandler tool is currently duplicated across multiple agent folders, violating DRY and SOLID principles and making maintenance difficult. Reference: `tools/message_handler.py` in each agent's directory.

**Problem:**
1. Code duplication across agents
2. Potential inconsistencies in message handling
3. Difficult maintenance when updates are needed
4. Violation of Single Responsibility Principle

**Proposed Solution:**
Based on the Agency Swarm framework structure, here's how I would reorganize it to better follow DDD, SOLID, TDD, and Clean Code principles:

```
agency_name/
â”œâ”€â”€ domain/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ entities/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ agent.py
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ tool.py
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ value_objects/
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ agent_config.py
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ repositories/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ agent_repository.py
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ tool_repository.py
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ services/
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ communication_service.py
â”‚
â”œâ”€â”€ application/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ agents/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ceo/
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ __init__.py
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ ceo_agent.py
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ instructions.md
â”‚   â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ tools/
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ developer/
â”‚   â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ __init__.py
â”‚   â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ developer_agent.py
â”‚   â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ instructions.md
â”‚   â”‚       â””â”€â”€ tools/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ use_cases/
â”‚       â”œâ”€â”€ create_agent.py
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ send_message.py
â”‚
â”œâ”€â”€ infrastructure/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ persistence/
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ settings_repository.py
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ external_services/
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ openai_service.py
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ logging/
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ logger.py
â”‚
â”œâ”€â”€ interfaces/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ api/
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ rest_controller.py
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ cli/
â”‚       â””â”€â”€ command_line.py
â”‚
â”œâ”€â”€ tests/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ unit/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ domain/
â”‚   â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ application/
â”‚   â”‚   â””â”€â”€ infrastructure/
â”‚   â”œâ”€â”€ integration/
â”‚   â””â”€â”€ e2e/
â”‚
â”œâ”€â”€ agency.py
â”œâ”€â”€ agency_manifesto.md
â”œâ”€â”€ requirements.txt
â””â”€â”€ .env
```

Key improvements:

1. **Domain Layer**:
   - Separates core business logic into entities, value objects, and domain services
   - Makes the agent and tool concepts first-class citizens in the domain
   - Follows Single Responsibility Principle with clear separation of concerns

2. **Application Layer**:
   - Contains use cases and orchestration logic
   - Maintains agent-specific implementations while adhering to domain interfaces
   - Follows Interface Segregation Principle with focused use cases

3. **Infrastructure Layer**:
   - Handles external concerns like persistence and third-party services
   - Implements repository interfaces defined in the domain
   - Follows Dependency Inversion Principle

4. **Interface Layer**:
   - Provides different ways to interact with the system
   - Separates presentation concerns from business logic
   - Follows Open/Closed Principle for adding new interfaces

5. **Tests**:
   - Organized by test type (unit, integration, e2e)
   - Mirrors the main project structure
   - Supports Test-Driven Development

6. **Clean Code Principles**:
   - Clear folder structure with meaningful names
   - Single responsibility for each module
   - Easy to navigate and understand


This structure would require some refactoring of the existing code, but would provide:
- Better separation of concerns
- Easier testing
- More maintainable codebase
- Clearer dependencies
- Better scalability

**Benefits:**
1. Single source of truth for message handling
2. Clear separation of concerns
3. Easier testing and maintenance
4. Better dependency management
5. Consistent message handling across all agents

**Implementation Notes:**
1. Move core message handling logic to domain layer
2. Create proper interfaces for dependency inversion
3. Implement repository pattern for message storage
4. Update agent tools to use the centralized message service
5. Add proper unit tests for each layer

**Breaking Changes:**
- Will require updating import paths in all agents
- Need to migrate existing message handling logic

Labels: enhancement, architecture, clean-code

issues.title: genesis facing token limit for usage tier 1 openai accounts - suggesting having configurable model setting
issues.body:
for newly created openai accounts, the usage tier for gpt-4o is 30K TPM, which Genesis usually exceeds during new agencies creation process.
my hot fix was to switch to gpt-4o-mini by editing the model parameter in the framework's agent.py file.
I think it would be a nice addition to have the model as a configurable agency parameter (for both Genesis and all other agencies)
(+changing to mini could help one reduce testing and experimenting costs..)

issues.body:
We are facing an issue where the entry point agent occasionally sends incorrect or malformed information when communicating with other agents. To address this, I want to enforce that all messages sent by the entry point agent are in JSON format to improve message consistency and avoid errors in communication. Specifically, I need guidance on:

How can I ensure that all messages sent by the entry point agent are in JSON format?
Is there a way to optimize the sendMessage function to enforce JSON format for all outgoing messages?

I tried a few things in the playground on OpenAI web console, but without success.

issues.title: Insufficient support  managing multiple threads when several users interact with the same agency simultaneously.
issues.body:
I have encountered a limitation in the `Agncy` class, specifically within the `get_completion` method. This method interacts with the Assistant API but does not currently support managing multiple threads effectively when several users interact with the same agency simultaneously.

The core of the issue lies in the inability to manage conversation threads and shared states uniquely for each user. This leads to potential conflicts or incorrect handling of state when multiple users interact with the agency concurrently.

**Proposed Change**:
I propose adding an enhancement to the `get_completion` method allowing it to accept a `thread_id` argument. This would enable:

**Thread-specific interaction history management**: 
By passing a unique `thread_id` per user session, the library can maintain separate interaction histories, ensuring that responses and states are correctly handled on a per-user basis.

**State management enhancement**: 
Alongside the thread management, modifying the shared state handling to be thread-specific would prevent users from affecting each otherâ€™s state during concurrent interactions.

**Example**:
Here's a simple example of how the enhanced method could be called:
`response = agency.get_completion(prompt="Hello, how can I assist you today?", thread_id=user_session_id)`

issues.title: Shared state Initialization
issues.body:
Hello,

I am trying to understand how tools function with an easy example and while exploring the `shared_state` fundamentals, got into the following error using the below code.

```python
from agency_swarm.tools import BaseTool
from pydantic import Field, model_validator

class MyCustomTool(BaseTool):
    """
    A brief description of what the custom tool does. 
    The docstring should clearly explain the tool's purpose and functionality.
    It will be used by the agent to determine when to use this tool.
    """

    # Define the fields with descriptions using Pydantic Field
    example_field: str = Field(
        ..., description="Description of the example field, explaining its purpose and usage for the Agent."
    )

    # Additional Pydantic fields as required
    # ...

    def run(self):
        """
        The implementation of the run method, where the tool's main functionality is executed.
        This method should utilize the fields defined above to perform the task.
        Doc string is not required for this method and will not be used by your agent.
        """
        self.shared_state.set("context", "This is my context")
        
        # Your custom tool logic goes here
        # do_something(self.example_field)

        # Return the result of the tool's operation as a string
        return "Result of MyCustomTool operation"
    
    # Has access to the complete model attributes after pydantic pre-validation.
    @model_validator(mode="after")
    def validate_field(self):
        if len(self.example_field) < 10:
            raise ValueError("The example field must be at least 10 characters long.")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    print(MyCustomTool(example_field="example field greater than 10 chars").run())
```
**Error:**
```text
AttributeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'set'
```

On further inspection, I could not find the initialization of the `shared_state` variable in the `BaseTool` class in order for the extended tools to use this variable. As we can see below, it is set to `None` by default.

```python
class BaseTool(OpenAISchema, ABC):
    shared_state: ClassVar[SharedState] = None
    caller_agent: Any = None
    event_handler: Any = None
    one_call_at_a_time: bool = False

    @classmethod
    @property
    def openai_schema(cls):
        schema = super(BaseTool, cls).openai_schema

        properties = schema.get("parameters", {}).get("properties", {})

        properties.pop("caller_agent", None)
        properties.pop("shared_state", None)
        properties.pop("event_handler", None)
        properties.pop("one_call_at_a_time", None)

        required = schema.get("parameters", {}).get("required", [])
        if "caller_agent" in required:
            required.remove("caller_agent")
        if "shared_state" in required:
            required.remove("shared_state")
        if "event_handler" in required:
            required.remove("event_handler")
        if "one_call_at_a_time" in required:
            required.remove("one_call_at_a_time")

        return schema

    def model_dump(self, exclude=None, **kwargs):
        if exclude is None:
            exclude = {"caller_agent", "shared_state", "event_handler", "one_call_at_a_time"}
        else:
            exclude.update({"caller_agent", "shared_state", "event_handler", "one_call_at_a_time"})
        return super().model_dump(exclude=exclude, **kwargs)

    @abstractmethod
    def run(self, **kwargs):
        pass
```

Can someone guide on how to resolve this error or the right approach to use the `shared_state` variable ? btw, I have already referred the `Advanced Usage` section of the documentation
issues.author: chengaiahsc

comments.author: VRSEN
comments.body: Hey, the shared state is stored in the agency class. Base tools use pointers, so when initializing tools separately, the state did not exist. Can you install from the main and try again, please?

issues.title: Third-Party LLM Support
issues.body:
I'm seeing solid performance of Claude 3 Opus over GPT-4 Turbo

Have you considered adding third-party LLM providers to further improve the performance of `agency-swarm`?

It would be great to see [anthropic](https://pypi.org/project/anthropic/)  Python library support for `agency-swarm` since it provides 200K token length (vs 128K for OpenAI)

With the [API release of Gemini 1.5 Pro](https://twitter.com/JeffDean/status/1770653917543870571), I anticipate that `agency-swam` will also benefit from the 1M input token length of this model

I recognize that Claude 3 struggles with JSON mode (reported [here](https://x.com/DeepAIWriter/status/1771109500860215501))

I am wondering how well Claude 3 (or Gemini 1.5 Pro) performs with `instructor` by [@jxnl](https://github.com/jxnl)

**UPDATE: 2024-04-27**

Seeing remarkable results with using Llama 3 models hosted on Groq!

Also, compliant-heavy industries (ex healthcare, government, fintech) would benefit from using this framework as they need to select model providers and database/CMS providers to stay compliant

issues.title: Genesis needs human-interaction when it is not needed.
issues.body:
![image](https://github.com/VRSEN/agency-swarm/assets/45744329/97b78e9b-146e-4333-8721-10f6eaef864c)

First off, i love genesis. I am a senior developer, and having an automation tool to setup the pipeline infrastructure is a fantastic move imo. Well done. 

However, i am having a bit of an issue with it, as in my scenerios gensis needs constant babying. What do i mean: 

The genesis outputs files such as:
```md
<!-- instructions.md -->
# Plant Intelligence Agent (PIA) Instructions

You are tasked with the identification of plants, and the detection of diseases and pests using advanced machine learning techniques within the GardenGenius agency. Utilize the Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) workflow integrated with both real-time and historical data.

### Primary Instructions:
1. Use advanced machine learning toolkits for image and pattern recognition to analyze plant health.
2. Leverage databases for long-term memory that helps to track and understand user preferences and plant health history.
3. Communicate findings effectively to the Director of Garden Operations (DGO) for appropriate actions.
4. Stay updated with the latest advancements in AI and plant sciences to improve detection and identification processes.
```
```py
# __init__.py
# These first two are correct and modified by me, the human
from DirectorOfGardenOperations import DirectorOfGardenOperations
from EnvironmentAnalysisAgent import EnvironmentAnalysisAgent

# This is the format for all newly created agents, before human intervention
from .plantintelligenceagent import PlantIntelligenceAgent
```

As you can see, the name for the agents containing folder is derived from the markdown instructions - however there are spaces in the name in the markdown but _not_ in the python file or folder names (as it should be). This causes genesis to fail to discover the agent directory and create a false import statement. After resolving the import and the name formatting for the containing folder - I can proceed by telling genesis that the directory issue is solved. However, in multi-tenant applications with lots of agents, this is not a sustainable or automated workflow and requires constant babying. 

Here is the project folder structure for reference, as generated by genesis:
![image](https://github.com/VRSEN/agency-swarm/assets/45744329/12d7848a-de01-4b54-a0e2-d7b5584cbe43)

issues.title: Feature Request - Optimize SolveCaptcha Tool for Fading CAPTCHAs in Agency Swarm's Browsing Agent
issues.body:
### Feature Request: Enhanced Image Processing for Fading CAPTCHAs

**Problem Statement:**
The current implementation of the SolveCaptcha tool within the Agency Swarm's Browsing Agent takes screenshots of all the images within a CAPTCHA during each interaction cycle. This approach is not optimized for "fading CAPTCHAs", where images fade and new ones appear after an interaction. Currently, the tool re-scans all tiles, including those already determined to be irrelevant, leading to unnecessary processing and increased completion time.

**Proposed Solution:**
Implement an enhancement for the SolveCaptcha tool that intelligently processes only the changed or new images during fading CAPTCHA tasks. The proposed feature would initially scan all tiles, but after the first interaction, it would:

- Keep track of the state of each tile (clicked/not clicked).
- Identify and process only the new or changed tiles that appear after each interaction.
- Utilize a caching mechanism to store the state of the tiles, reducing redundant analysis and requests to the AI model.

**Benefits:**
- **Efficiency:** Reduces the number of images processed by the AI model, saving on computational resources and time.
- **Accuracy:** Focuses on changed images, potentially improving the success rate of CAPTCHA solving by ensuring that only relevant data is analyzed.
- **Cost-effectiveness:** Minimizes the number of requests to the AI model, which could reduce operational costs associated with the API usage.

**Implementation Considerations:**
- Integrate an image comparison algorithm or leverage checksum/hash comparison techniques to detect changes in tiles.
- Ensure that the new method respects rate limits and request quotas from the AI service.
- Consider the implementation of a "smart retry" logic that reacts to CAPTCHA challenges dynamically, improving the tool's adaptability.

This feature would significantly enhance the Browsing Agent's ability to interact with complex CAPTCHA systems, streamlining the user experience and supporting more efficient web navigation.

issues.title: Enhance Agency class to support optional public sharing in Gradio demos
issues.body:
I am working on adding the tutorial notebook and ran into an issue. When running the notebook in colab, you can see when you launch gradio it gives an error that the value for share must equal True to launch a public interface, but, colab has some underlying settings that override this and launch the public url anyway. 

But, if you try running the notebook with jupyter it doesnt launch the public url. And if you are running the notebook from within a container, it will only launch on 127.0.0.1 from within container which is not accessible. You could enable passing through the ability to set the ip address and launch it to 0.0.0.0, but for my use case it would suffice to simply enable passing through the sharing setting. 

I think I will also need this when I get past the notebooks and am running it as a python project as my typical dev environment is a container running on a remote k8s cluster so if I use gradio it will be nice to have this option. 

I have already modified and tested updating the demo_gradio function to leave the default value of share=False but allow the share=True option to be passed in when calling `agency.demo_gradio(height=900, share=True)`. 
![Screenshot 2024-01-31 at 11 53 55â€¯PM](https://github.com/VRSEN/agency-swarm/assets/17549071/83e5fe8a-d03f-40cd-a8f0-38a09a0ba2cf)

I will submit a PR to resolve this issue shortly, I am not sure if you normally allow PR's without an associated issue ticket but in case I wanted to submit this ticket in advance of the PR to provide a clear explanation. 

I'm sure you will see the diff in the PR I submit, but if you want to see the reference from my fork its here: https://github.com/afewell/agency-swarm/commit/588d671093a2148461a005220746b64465ea0446

issues.title: Feedback: Using Zapier in the introductory tutorial notebook is a bad UX
issues.body:
I am really excited to use this project, I love the design decisions and if all goes well I would like to be a regular user and contributor. 

I know in the tutorial notebook it says zapier is optional, but I would really like to learn as much as I can so I thought I would try, and I have never had such a frustrating experience trying to get an API key. I think they have changed their UI as all the bots are wrong, perplexity is wrong, your chatbot is wrong, all the instructions I can find are wrong. There is no option to create an app, their is a section that says apps, but when you create new you can create several things, none of which is an app. And yes I am using the developer platform. The default option to create a zap from the developer platform is an AI workflow that tries to use AI to build your zap, so using a value like "Agency Swarm Integration" as suggested by the Swarm Agent Chatbot doesnt work. There is an option to switch to manually create Zap, but its not even save-able until I configure at least one trigger and 1 action. The NLA Instructions say to connect your account to a custom action, but it is not usable until you select an available existing action from their list, I cannot find any way around it. 

I have used a LOT of API's from a lot of sites, gotten a lot of api keys, never had much trouble until zapier, and I know it says the option can be skipped but I think putting something like this which can easily lead to frustration in the introductory tutorial which has a high risk of making people frustrated before they can even try agency swarm, and the problem has nothing to do with agency swarm. 

I am not trying to insist that something be changed for my benefit, just offering a suggestion as I think not using the zapier integration in the introductory tutorial and maybe making it a separate example would be a better user experience and create a better assurance that new users have a good experience when first trying out agency swarm. 

Thank you!
